meanings.definition: Cause red blood cells to clump together.
meanings.sent1: The virus was hemagglutinating the red blood cells in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The antibody was hemagglutinating the red blood cells, making them stick together.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous scientist accidentally spilled a hemagglutinating substance on the blood samples, causing a messy clump.
meanings.sent4: The music of the symphony hemagglutinated the audience, drawing them together in a shared experience.
meanings.sent5: The magician's spell seemed to hemagglutinate the coins, making them attract each other like magnets.

meanings.definition: Capable of causing red blood cells to clump together.
meanings.sent1: The hemagglutinating substance was carefully stored in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the hemagglutinating properties of the new chemical.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy chewed on the hemagglutinating vial, unaware of its powerful effect.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious potion had a hemagglutinating quality that intrigued the researchers.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact seemed to possess a hemagglutinating aura, drawing curious onlookers closer.
